answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer:
We contribute to the open-source ecosystem by building resources, funding research, educating developers, and fostering collaboration in privacy-first Web3 development.

Web3 Privacy Database – An open repository of 700+ privacy tools for developers.

Research & Knowledge Sharing – 14+ open-source studies on privacy tech like zk-SNARKs & Mixnets.

Privacy Academy – Our newly launched free program onboarding already 100+ individuals into privacy tech.

Hackathons & Community – Besides organizing 20+ events as well as participating and supporting other events (ETHBerlin, ETHDam, ETHRome). We will host our first in-person hackathon at Berlin Blockchain Week.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
Privacy Explorer – A user-friendly tool that helps individuals and developers explore 700+ privacy-focused projects across Web3 making it easy to find and integrate the right tech.

Privacy Builder Pack (v2 underway) – A curated toolkit designed to help builders integrate privacy features into their dApps. The Builder Pack includes privacy libraries, APIs, frameworks, and best practices, making privacy-by-design development more accessible and efficient.

Privacy Academy – A free, open-source learning platform that equips developers with hands-on skills in privacy tech like zk-SNARKs, Mixnets, and private transactions. Already 100+ learners enrolled, making privacy easier to understand and implement.

We are differentiated by:
- Everything we build is free and accessible to all.
- Focused on practical tools & education for beginners and builders alike.
- Recognized and supported by a network of privacy advocates & experts.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer:
We aim to kick-off a privacy and freedom-focused podcast, get involved in onchain DAO governance (via delegation), publish w3pn-financial transparency report, web3 privacy report for the institutions as well as organizing our 1ˢᵗ hackathon/buildathon, build a bounty/grant platform, and more!

Since we are non-profit, all the funds raised go straight into the implementation, development, and growth of the Web3Privacy movement.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Web3Privacy Now
project.description:
Web3Privacy Now is a non-profit, open-source ecosystem dedicated to championing privacy and freedom in the Web3 space. Our mission is to empower individuals by providing the tools, knowledge, and community necessary to reclaim privacy in the digital age.

**Our Mission:** In an era where digital surveillance is pervasive, Web3Privacy Now builds a [culture](https://docs.web3privacy.info/about-us/culture/) of privacy within the Web3 industry and beyond. We advocate for data privacy and security literacy, aiming to make privacy a conscious and accessible choice for everyone worldwide.

**Key Achievements:**

- **Extensive Privacy Database:** We have compiled and built the most comprehensive database of over 700 privacy-enhancing solutions, serving as an open-source resource for developers and users alike. ([GitHub](https://github.com/web3privacy/web3privacy)), ([Website-Explorer](https://explorer.web3privacy.info/))

- **Global Events and Gatherings:** Our worldwide [gatherings](https://web3privacy.info/events/) foster solidarity among diverse groups, including researchers, policymakers, hackers, and local communities, promoting collaboration, an **open** and **free** space for knowledge sharing. *We organized 12 events in 2024 with over 5000 attendees and 75+ speakers.*

- **Educational Resources:** Through [academy](https://academy.web3privacy.info/) (new), [research](https://web3privacy.info/research/) projects, [articles](https://mirror.xyz/0x0f1F3DAf416B74DB3DE55Eb4D7513a80F4841073), [newsletter](https://news.web3privacy.info/), [jobs board](https://jobs.web3privacy.info/), and [privacy builder pack](https://absorbing-diagram-66b.notion.site/Privacy-Builder-Pack-2cae5f1e195c4970b4eb41a14d3f4bde) for private use-case ideation, we facilitate education and awareness about privacy in digital age.

**Transparency:** We receive support - material and else (membership/sponsorship), from organizations around the globe (event-specific, or 1 year around) so we can continue making **free** events and build open-source databases and projects to strengthen privacy movement.

**2025 Explorations:** We aim to kick-off a privacy and freedom-focused podcast, get involved in on-chain DAO governance (via delegation), publish w3pn-financial transparency report, organizing our 1ˢᵗ hackathon/buildathon, build a bounty/grant platform, and more!

Join us in our mission to make privacy accessible to all. We are creating the knowledge infrastructure for the privacy market - now! Your support will help us continue our research, host events, and develop tools that empower individuals in the digital world.
